EKNFHr6KeX9Sp6Hlgibnlg.text: Pig in the window and pulled pork flavor selection. Was nice and filled a gap but thought it would have been so much better. Always wanted to try it but every time we went it was either closed or a Q was out the door. They close once the whole pig is gone, shows how busy they get. Would try again.

O2QloI3QiyFNWkynPJxYLQ.text: Perfect fueling stop when wandering around the city. Vegans/vegetarians, beware. Carnivores/omnivores, rejoice.

g_GnqjZlS5CVuxX3t9Qnpw.text: Fabulously honest, nourishing, hunger-beating and simple good food. Eat it! The Oink shop on Victoria Street is a sight to behold, with resplendant porker on show, but you need to be swift and fortunate to score a pew inside. They are quickly devoured if you are remotely hungry however, so no problem with taking too long to trade seats! Looking forward to sampling as outside catering at a special event soon too!

Ps4O-yZLLyzGBacgV0mDfw.text: Loved this place! They do one thing, and they do it very well.  The whole family loved their pork sandwiches.  The service was very friendly.  So happy to have found Oink on our vacation.

nTei8lUcocV_lH-CnxU6kQ.text: Firstly I need to say a MASSIVE thank you to all the Yelpers who have contributed to making Oink the #1 Yelped about eatery in Edinburgh because otherwise the chances are I would never have happened upon the place as Victoria Street and the Grassmarket aren't areas I tend to gravitate towards for any reason.... that being said, I've now gone to Oink twice in as many days.  Ladies and gents, your attention please.... I. Am. In. Love.  They say the best ideas are simple and this is no exception. In a nutshell, this place sells pork sandwiches. End of.  Oh okay there are a few variables to throw in there for the thinking man (or woman!):  Small, medium or large? White or brown? Haggis or stuffing? Cranberry or apple sauce? Drink?  Wow, lot to think about there. Now I'm hungry again..... wonder if I can get up there in 20 mins...? Traffic should be alright......  Whoa! Talk about digression! Oink clearly brings out the caveman in me! Actually I'm surprised I didn't come up with this idea as this is pretty much all I ate in Sydney as they have these roast delis all over the place. Good job I didn't as there's no way I could compete with the meaty perfection of Oink.  Absolute godsend.  Bloke behind the counter is a good lad too.  COUPLE OF TIPS FOR THE NEWBY:  1) The crackling is phenomenal. Get there early, ask for crackling.  2) The hog is cooked in gravy. If you like gravy, be sure to ask the guy for the meat at the bottom of the dish. Wow!

pWcjcHcT9LeCS3qFk7Xt8A.text: A great idea, but the food didn't particularly float my boat.  Overall, we said: "I quite enjoyed Oink. I like their schtick, the clarity of their vision, the simplicity of things. Theirs is a very commendable, sustainable model, one that others could and should be following to showcase our fabulous locally sourced ingredients. But is the food worthy of the adulation that's routinely heaped upon the place? Nah, not for me. The verdict on pulled pork is that I can take or leave it."

IrcdvdBMpTlZeLgiRtovMg.text: Wow -- pulled pork sandwiches! Get it with haggis on top! The roasted pig carcass in the window is super tantalizing. This place is fast food done right. In fact, it's the best fast food in the world. They will get you sorted with fresh pig meat in between two buns and a good topping faster than you can sneeze.

_KeqZtKDvzzKwoDyf7w5Pw.text: Oink! completely redefines the quality standards that you should expect from a fast food restaurant. The hog rolls are absolutely delicious cooked with quality fresh ingredients that will leave you craving for more. Located just around the corner from the Grassmarket area it is a mandatory stop in Edinburgh. Because it delivers in style everything that it sets itself to, it gets 5 stars. Probably the best fast food I have ever tried.

_sQjgWxcppvcsGAbkcGrCw.text: Holy wow that cracklin' is like delicious meat candy. This was a perfect lunch, with every component lending itself to a party in my mouth (I went with a brown roll, sage stuffing, apple relish, and of course cracklin... add in the tender flavorful roasted pork and you're in heaven). And for a reasonable price too. This is a no brainer, if you're any kind of pork lover you must have an Oink sandwich ASAP.

mWmpNABl5GOQTuv-09GNOQ.text: The place is simple and serves one thing, pork in bread with two accessories. The food was ok but a bit too based on the pig that was pretty basic taste   the staff were ok, but not very nice, felt that they looked askance at me because I'm well dressed. (sorry for it then!)   It's fantastic fun with the concept places, I think the food was good but not worth as well as review site had, then I baked potato place on Cockburn's better with more choices.

8iaS_oAO079-l88WNOJT3g.text: Wow, what a great concept! Happened upon this place today on the way to Holyrood so we decided to stop in after seeing the hog with crisy crackling in the front window. They keep it simple with just a few toppings so nothing distracts from the juicy tenderness of the pork. I had mine with the stuffing, apple and bbq sauce on the side.  The meat is so flavorful and delish by itself. Get some crackling on the side; it's so crispy and tasty and gave my roll a nice crunch.  This is a nice, quick lunch and is very reasonably priced for such high quality.

wdsmOAqzhuRzSfiPqSAHuw.text: Good, cheap, fast, and a bit messy eat for a quick lunch. The pork is very tender served piping hot with soft hot buns. Definitely recommend stopping by at some point if you're in Edinburgh for the festival.

H7dEe0B8MOoq9cYCl33zqg.text: If pigs could fly they'd all taste like this.  Since they don't you'll have to visit Oink to try heavenly roast pig here on earth.  There's only one thing on the menu: a roast pig roll.  If you're from USA like I am, you might think you'll miss the smoke flavor in what looks a bit like pulled pork. Trust me, you won't.  This whole pig is lovingly roasted for 12-14 hours and then carved into sandwiches, served on a soft white or wheat roll with either rosemary onion relish or haggis (trust me, get the haggis) and sweet chili sauce or apple sauce.  The haggis provides just the right level of earthiness to cut through the salty fat of the port.  And don't forget to ask for cracklin, a square of crispy skin cut with kitchen shears and placed on the roll.  Get there early as they make one hog a day, and they sell out.

b82P_LgCD-aLZ_lE_vNTTQ.text: Visited Oink while living in Scotland a couple years back and to this day I am still upset at how I was treated.  We ordered their delicious sandwiches - but my cousin asked for extra sauce because her sandwich was a little dry for her taste - she even offered to pay before finishing her sentence. The manager (or owner) was so upset by this - she said "you Americans - always wanting more" and then went on a rant about how entitled we are.  We were stunned.  I told her that was an incredibly rude thing to say and she said we weren't welcome back. By far the most awful dining experience I'v ever had. I called later and asked to have my complaint to management addressed - never happened (which is why I assume the person who helped was a manager). Business does not care about their customers.  Disappointing to this day.

Sg_HJ8PeNqE5Q2uBirRFVQ.text: Walked past this place earlier on today and spotted the pulled pork and the head of a pig through the window. Hungry after the museum I treated myself to a sandwich here. The menu is very simple with only 2 size options, the pork is juicy and tender and the stuffing accompanied it perfectly. Sadly the bread isn't that great.

Dz8UNRsNkJvyeTm3dugEQw.text: What a great idea. Get a huge roasted porker and sit him in the window for all to see, heid and all. Then serve up big shredded portions of him on a bun with a choice (or combination) of sage and onion, apple sauce or sweet chilli relish. Additionally you can get some crackling for an extra 50p or so. Brilliant.   I'm deducting 1 star for the fact that you can't get a nice cold beer to wash it down. Otherwise no complaints from me!

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

WMxeV8eVo80_5C6RZERAhQ.text: Heaven on a bun delivered by people who love the pig.  We were wandering down Victoria Street looking for a Middle Eastern place where my daughter could get a falafel when we passed by OINK.  There's a beautiful golden roasted pig in the window that they are pulling the meat off for sandwiches and I know that this is my lunch.  Not many options at OINK: White or brown bread Haggis or sage stuffing Apple sauce or chili relish Crackling or no crackling Small, medium or large  There is a counter with a few stools and a table with a couple of chairs but mostly it is a carry-out business.  It was a beautiful day so we took our sandwiches down the block to a small square at the intersection of Victoria and Grassmarket and ate on a bench outside with the pigeons.  It was perfect.  It's that simple.  The staff were delightful and the sandwich was even better.  This is quality stuff served up by people who love what they do and they do it well.  I would travel the 3000 miles back to Edinburgh for another one of those delicious sandwiches.

mnbxtjToVP_2NsQhJpTu8A.text: Dead pig in a bun. What's not to like?

wyu7CUcgg3HEmubUQ90ofw.text: Brilliant idea. Put a roasted pig in the window and feed him/her to the public. When the meat of this pig is gone, close the shop.  All they sell is this pig all day. What a wonderful concept, so simple and soooooooooooooooooo delicious. The taste is more like American style pulled-pork BBQ, though without the smokiness or BBQ sauce. With this, you get sage and onion seasoning sprinkled on it, and perhaps some haggis or sweet apple sauce on top. I live in Germany now, and this would be the only place outside of Germany in Europe that would make me forsake a Bratwurst.   Only caveat--- the bread was cheap, horrible hamburger buns straight out of the supermarket aisle. Yuck! They need decent bread, something as hearty and heavy to stand up to the pork. Some artisan, handmade bread would complement the handmade meat, instead of being a cheap-ass afterthought. I deducted 1 star for the horrible bread rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

k91fOWQEUGIzqijpIqAJKg.text: First timer (Edinburgh, Scotland)  As a pork lover I had to stop at this place. I had an Oink sandwich and it was goooooood. The pork skin gave it that extra crunch and texture to the experience. Aside, from Puerto Rican cuisine (and maybe Dominican), the Scots and Brits know how to work with pork.

WBVCppO8C10Si2C43BSLuQ.text: Server explained our options and what was most popular as it was our first time at a "Scottish Hog Roast" restaurant. Ended up getting the medium roast pork sandwich (basically the only thing on the menu) complimented by sage and onion stuffing and house made bbq sauce. Crisps and a root beer made it a meal for a reasonable 8-9 pounds.

-QbW4fpPMRGj00Ccm1pQTA.text: How many Oinks can you find as you explore the streets of Edinburgh? Oink is one catchy fast-food local chain you'll spot in several neighborhoods. With the hog's head prominently showcased at the store window (awesome marketing technique!), it's hard to pass by this joint without any awespiring head-turners. The meat is moist and light in flavors, and it's suggested to go with different spreads. Ask for crispy pork skin and sandwich it with the meat. It will burst with flavors!

MX0lh7Rh8_OXdH8PUcq7kg.text: Dead pig in a roll. Does exactly what it says on the tin, in three different sizes.

S4U60eovPDzY3MoBHgcSQw.text: If you're a pork lover, this place is a must-visit.   For me, it was the pig's skin (they call it a different name here) that was the highlight. You have to ask for extras because it's free and it's good.  For 6 pounds, you get an Oink sandwich (the medium-sized one), chips and a drink.  You get through the line fairly quickly and once you get the food, there's usually a seat to sit and enjoy the pork.  People were steaming and flooding this place all day. This was no surprise because this place is good.   Why can't they have something like this in California?

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Line all day but it moves quickly.

l0Y3VW2w3ucUcEtIFHiR-Q.text: We stopped by yesterday to get out of the rain - it was a great place to go. It only serves the pork sitting in the window.  It was inexpensive and served generous portions.  It was the first time I add haggis and spicy cheese sauce.  So glad we gave it a go!

u_cItvYw-h2-NtugAUISvw.text: Read about this place on social media and when I went to Edinburgh for the weekend I was determined to try it and I'm so glad I did. It's such a simple concept - pick the amount of meat you want, your bread, filling and sauce and voila the best damn sandwich ever! I had the safe and onion with homemade bbq sauce and it was amazing! Will definitely return here whenever in Edinburgh.

aiTQqvGe_dn1esmWVxN0vg.text: Cheap, filling, and quick! A variety of different sauces and options. Definitely worth a visit if you're shopping or sightseeing near Victoria Street!

s0eaXmM_O2O-iAs66WP14w.text: Best pig we've had outside of the States! I do pig roasts all the time with family, so I consider myself a bit of a pork expert. As soon as I walked up to the place and saw that amazing pig in the window I knew I was in the right place! Just go, don't think, go now.

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

d2BfR8R5rQqMTMdBzOXZcg.text: Keep it simple, don't have a complicated menu and do it right. They hit all 3. Don't forget a coffee and shortbread!

XJfjRSvXO5QdWpUEpt-SVg.text: Yum! Freshly roasted pork on a soft bun, delicious. I didn't get any of the sauces because I'm not sure they won't be sweet, I don't like sweet with savory. I got the combo which included chips and a soft drink for about 7 pounds. Totally worth it!

fjMmQqBxSMWRdrFncZkhlA.text: Delicious!!  I saw that Oink was a must eat in Edinburgh, but I thought it'd be another overrated place so I didn't have it in my plans. I walking along High Street and I ran into Oink, so I thought "I've heard of this place, let's give it a try."  I wasn't really hungry at this time and I was glad to see that they had a Piglet (mini) size option. The staff suggested that I should just get the Oink (regular) for an extra pound, but I said no thanks.  I got my order, and I was slightly disappointed to see how small my Piglet sandwich was. I took my first bite, and it was AMAZING. I wanted more.   I highly recommend this place to anyone. It does't look too appetizing but it's so good. The pork will melt in your mouth.  --  taste / 5 aesthetics / 2 vibe / 3 service / 4 price for quality / 4 OVERALL / 3.6

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. piglet (oops focused on the oink sign instead of the food)

3FlxM_rD1M7o_GsiQ2hIkw.text: As we walked down High Street (or so we thought it was) came upon this delicious smell, and saw the most BEAUTIFUL roasted pig in the window.   Now, if you're a vegan/vegetarian or offended by pork, WHY ARE YOU READING A YELP REVIEW ON A PLACE CALLED OINK!!    Bugger off!  So we had some lunch options, one was a tattie place, or another pub if that was busy, but this was beckoning to us.   We continued our touristy walk down to Parliament Building, and came back up the street.  So simple.  Pick a size, pick a bread, want stuffing, pick a sauce.   I didn't want to ask a ton of questions because of a food allergy, so I asked for chilli cheese sauce on the side.   It was a little spicer than I wanted, but the sandwich did NOT NEED IT.  It was SO damn moist.  (And I hate that word). Usually pulled pork needs some sauce, living in the US, it's BBQ, or slathered in something - this DID NOT.  I honestly didn't notice the sage onion dressing until my last bite, so all I got was pork heavenliness.    Nice sit down place to rest and enjoy your meal.

nQoG9Ou8l-0QMHuG99xECA.text: That food made me love Scotland even more! It's simple and so tasty! I was always a bit obsessed with fast food, and this one made me want more :D  The meat is prepared wonderfully, it's well baked and yet, not dry, a bit juicy, just perfect with the bread and the rest.  Thank you very much for your effort and everything you do. Definitely will come again :)

y1tqhiIN2kChP6ujvsJp5Q.text: Ohhhh that roasted pig in the window looked so enticing. I had to... Got the hog in a box with apple sage stuffing and chili cheese sauce. It was delicious. The workers were also friendly although it is definitely a stop and go place, not somewhere one would hangout. I'm glad I didn't get the sandwich because the bread would've been too filling. Say yes to crackling!

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Oinktastik!

YvYwLU6-M36MHRtEBljS2g.text: Hog roast!!! Slow roast pork, haggis and crispy pig skin in one bite. What more does one need. Oh, it's also cheap at 6 for a sandwich. I would come back religiously for this place.

uuGLPUGwhfplg_m7yIcraQ.text: Oink is a pretty good stop for lunch. It's very fast so if you're looking for a quick bite I definitely recommend it.   The sandwich itself is quite good, and it's definitely a great bang for your buck. My only feeling is that the meat sometimes feels a bit too dry. I highly recommend asking for extra sauce because that will fix the problem. All of the sauces are good so order whatever you're in the mood for and you won't be disappointed.

ZW42Q5-wqDXCW6ZEVctQ0Q.text: Seriously tender and flavorful pulled pork. I stopped in after a chilly morning of exploring Edinburgh and the steamy, delicious sandwich gave me enough energy to continue exploring for the rest of the day.

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pulled pork sandwich

4uQONRurXRvWvOwonRS63Q.text: Great, lean pork sandwiches with a variety of sauces to choose from. Not many seats, but, if you're lucky enough to find somewhere to sit, it's a good lunch spot. Ideal for quick service. It seems like most people grab a sandwich and keep walking down Victoria street.

AZ8MfJtjLamfvuqEUUDe3A.text: Quick, tasty lunch spot.  Super busy with limited sitting space.  Pork is good and super fresh and prices are right.

XS3Z-YNUAq1oM8jnK__xCw.text: Delicious...that's all you need to say! Great customer service, too! Yelp wants me to say more, but I would like to leave it as I said, Yelp! :-)

w0JjVF0Tc1vtu41b1fIMlg.text: OH......I was smitten when I saw the sign in the window that said "sold out". I turned to my sister who is not into pig and said- "I don't know about you but I'm coming back here tomorrow." Fast forward to the next day.....  As we headed down the hill we saw a gentle line. As we got closer we glimpsed the whole hog proudly, cracklingly, juicily, nestled in the window.  Imagine my glee that  the pigs come from a local farm and are roasted that day. We opted for the child's portion and thankfully we did because even those suckers were giant.  Since the store front is tiny and the day glorious we went and sat on benches where the hangings used to take place.   This sandwhich easily changed my life for the better. I've eaten my fare share of pork in all of its glories and this puts the others to shame. I would easily crawl on broken glass to get here...why oh why do you have to be so far from me?!?!?!?!?!?

16Nvc21pWgXu6asb7tcxjA.text: Do one thing, do it well.  Love those places.   Everyone has said what there is to be said. But I might also add that the street that this place is on is really cute! Made even cuter by the tasty (not-so-little) piggie in the window...

ms3Q3il1Gr8hOL5WCZvQHQ.text: Pig - Check Massive - Check Stuffing/applesauce - Check Less than a fiver - SERIOUSLY Amazing.  That is all. Get some pig in you.

gzXYgMniUhHAc8I2PfIC_Q.text: I come from a land (North Carolina) where pig is king, and few versions of roasted pork can compete with my good ole Eastern NC-style barbecue.  Oink can.  Try walking by the massive, chopped pig with head on in the window and NOT stopping to salivate. Just try it.  This sandwich is hands down the best in Edinburgh. Order whatever size you think you can handle with the haggis stuffing and apple sauce. Your mouth will come alive like Lazarus being raised from the dead.   As a self-professed roasted, chopped pig aficionado, I can guarantee Oink will be one of the best, if not the best, pork sandwiches you will EVER eat. Let us all pray that they never move from their delightful Victoria Street storefront, unless it is to open up delicious franchises all across the country.

y6UqWBjTkedb1ICIRzJlhg.text: I live in a small Tennessee town near Nashville.  The most prominent restaurant in our small town is a BBQ joint that cooks whole hogs on the weekend.  So it was a little strange to walk around Edinburgh and see (a much smaller) whole hog in the window at Oink.  Strange but tasty.  This was a little different than the whole hog that I'm used to in Middle Tennessee, but it was excellent.  Really liked the piece of crackling on the sandwich - that was a really interesting texture on top of the pork.  Friendly staff, sell what you cooked and then that's it.  Just another great spot in Edinburgh.

F1xp3Hvj47BgQd07hPS6Hg.text: Piggy goodness!  Look, I am a shameless carnivore.  One of my two favorite shirts is from Boccalone in San Francisco (Chris Cosentino's salumeria).  The other is a print of a creepily delighted pig slicing itself into saucisson.  So when a joint advertises itself by placing an entire roast pig in the window, which is gradually being shredded bit by bit over the course of the day, I'M THERE.  For some, the sight of a whole roasted animal being slowly pulled apart is grotesque.  For me, it is grotesquely delightful.  And oh, was it succulent, my friends.  And oh, my children, did the crispy exterior merit the high praise of PORK CANDY.  I can't believe I'm saying this, but now one of the best pulled pork sandwiches I have ever had was in the United Kingdom (and proud nation of Scotland!).  To be fair, I'm an Amurricun, and my great preference for pulled pork is with a healthy dash of low-temp smoking and some Carolinas/Arkansas-style vinegar sauce.  But the methode-UK isn't so bad, either...I would've opted for the haggis and chilli sauce sandwich, but they were out of haggis.  I was already in a festive mood from the Christmas Market, so I plopped myself at a table, my massive sandwich bedecked with sage and onion stuffing and applesauce.  I will be hard pressed not to eat one of these every time I go to Edinburgh.  Keep me away from Victoria Street, I beg of you!

bMF9Rs9DN2BA_TtKNiWpWw.text: It isn't everyday you come across a whole roast pig. That is unless you are in Spain or France. Both countries notorious for their love of pork and roasting the piggies in their entirety.   I was immediately drawn to this place. A decade ago I probably would've thought it barbaric to see such a sight, but now with two Pollan books under my belt I feel better about actually seeing the pig that I am about to eat Of course the next step according to M.Pollan would be to go out and kill it myself. Well, we just haven't reached that level yet. But I like that instead of seeing dissected pieces of meat in no way resembling a pig, we actually see what we are eating. It's much more of an organic experience, one step closer to nature. Yes, I do realise I am getting very philosophical. This is something that tends to happen quite often.  They were out of the brown buns so we had the white. The buns are the traditional scottish rolls that I have come to love. In total you are entitled to 4 choices here.   1. The size of your roll.  2. Whether or not said roll is white or brown  3. The filling: sage & onion stuffing or haggis  4.  Lastly the sauce, apple sauce or chilli sauce.      Thats it.  To many, that may not seem like enough choices. As consumers nowadays we love to have millions of options. Yet, I have come to understand that when a place has less choice, this means they get to concentrate on obtaining excellent quality ingredients. That is exactly what has happened here. Because this place only offers one sandwich they have perfected it.   Another plus is that they have root beer in the fridge.

eqqKg2RjKJ0EcYo9uK-1AA.text: A delicious roast pig with stuffing on a bap (which is a roll of bread, of course I didn't know what a bap was, but I do now) was perfect after a long walk through Edinburgh Castle. Super close too, just walk around a corner or take a shortcut down some slightly creepy but totally safe stairs, and you'll see it. Keep your eyes peeled for the bright PINK sign. Yummy pork goodness! You can't beat the price. There are a few seats inside, but if you're in a large group then its more of a take-out spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

QEprfmT2tA4ganreTetLjw.text: The look is quite appetizing but the taste is a bit off for asian palate. Not recommended and wont come back

a4U3VFBw-VjQBtaA6h_Pog.text: Somewhat cruely named, OINK does exactly what it says on the shop window - Hog Roast.  Being a big fan of pork, I was hugely excited about the promise of spit roasted hog and crackling - and I wasnt disapointed. My advice however is to get there early, because OINK is very popular - mainly because it offers the chance of something different to eat in the city.  Speaking to the jolly man who served me, I also found out that not only does OINK have its own premises, it can be found in the weekly farmers market along with the two farmers who own the place, still selling thier wares.  OINK is something different, and very tasty - if you can get there in time!

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. OINK

3ujxsMq_oithjQHwZe4Xqg.text: This place doesn't have to do much to get you inside. There is a giant pig in the window with crunchy pieces just asking to be eaten!!! As I was drooling in the window people who were exiting told me I wouldn't regret it. It was great. Since my first experience I have eaten there 2 other times and gotten different variations of sauces and spreads. They are all good!! Also the price is great for the amount of food you get. Don't forget to ask for a crunchy piece!!

LVT6DqE25jh1x_7xL6M8Qg.text: Amazing sandwiches, simple and really delicious. Chili relish and haggis gets another recommendation from me. Nothing quite like the carnal satisfaction of staring down the animal you're currently eating.  Also note that Victoria Street is home to a yarn store next to a pig sandwich shop next to a cheese shop next to a shop selling artisanal liquors next to a bookstore. Victoria Street is now my favorite street in the whole world.

NGn5xDThitbuOj7NHqGRiQ.text: Oink does one thing and it does it exceptionally well---delicious pulled pork sandwiches. What more could you want---hot flavoured pig, apple sauce, either haggis or onion sage stuffing and of course some crackling.   In the window you are greeted by a massive roast pig--ears, snots and all in full view. Yes it's disgusting, but it's a beautiful foodie sight nonetheless.   This sandwich shop needs to be on your short-list!

zcoBObK9A3oURTXvdxFQiQ.text: I came on a business trip to Edinburgh. I found it on Yelp and I was intrigued. I ordered the oink with haggis and the mild chili and loved it. Be sure to get the cracklin, as well on your sandwich. Great place for a quick bite while sightseeing near the castle.

cg9MjSx6YrHtyRNzGynhew.text: This place is a great way to try haggis if you are a tourist because the cover it with delicious apple chutney and pulled pork.    Seeing the poor pig I was about to eat in the window was a bit of a downer, obviously not enough of a downer that I didn't eat my sandwich like I was a pig myself.  If haggis isn't your bag they also have stuffing.  A great quick meal in the middle of the city.

tWQ3SQaeqIFhl-YGPYNxtQ.text: hmmmmmmmm.....Pork.....Drool..... This is some of the best pulled pork I have ever had better then some of the mom and pop soul food places in the bible belt of north america. I recommend all of it, but if you want something different try a sandwich with some fried pork skin on top with the haggis and spicy sauce. Its messy and rather large portion but it is the Best in the city. For you folks from America especially down South, if you like your soul food stop in here, say Hi , and order one of these tasty sandwiches . I promise you wont be disappointed but be warned, get in early because ,I kid you not, the Que ( or "Line"as we Americans call it ) will stretch out the door down and around the block its that popular.

zbIuT-_K3WlJayQtT0VHpA.text: And this is how pork is done properly, ladies and gents.  We stopped in for a pre-lunch snack before our 2:30 lunch at The Kitchin. Yeah, I know. But it's just how we roll. I asked the owner what the best combo was; he told me: white with haggis and chili and a little cracklin'. Sweet baby jesus, this man knows what he's talking about. So good!  Oink is a shining example of what is going right with the Edinburgh food scene. They know what they do well and capitalize on it. It's a must when in Edinburgh.

Wu9N6rvO3ip8h3jgSygakg.text: I try to avoid this place as often as possible, due to the fact that I work opposite Oink, and people would start making "oink" noises behind my back if I didn't. When I saw Oink take over the old leather goods shop, and heard how simple their formula would be I though this could be genius or disaster. After a couple of years on the street and selling out of pig everyday even on quiet January days, it's genius.  So I now treat myself to the odd 'Grunter' (the large roll), with haggis and chilli relish. And it feels so good.  *Anyone else thought how good it would be to stagger home after midnight and wish you could order a hog roll, shame they sell out by about 3-4pm*

kb_x5cRLKt-7QZjX5DExew.text: An Edinburgh institution... As I've been living abroad for the past while, I make it a priority to come here whenever I'm back in Edinburgh. It's a fabulous wee place that does what it's good at, and when I say good, I mean expertly skilled. I have to say that I'm not very adventurous, and always, without doubt, go for stuffing and apple sauce combo, which to me is perfect, but I've been reliably informed that the other combinations are all winners.  But get there early during the Fringe, the queue that snakes along Victoria Street starts early and before you know it the whole pig is gone!

atB0a1Dk_Lbc26aH1Lx0-w.text: This is the perfect spot for a quick lunch off the Royal Mile. The menu is simple: you choose a sandwich size, stuffing and sauce. I got the piglet with sage and onion and apple sauce, and I've nothing but good things to say. Pork was juicy and tender and went perfect with everything else in the sandwich.   No complaints about the service- the employees answered any questions I had. The space is quite small but that's not a big deal as people are in and out of the joint quick.  Pro tip: get the crackling, it will make your amazing sandwich a thousand times better!

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Piglet with crackling

4w7vzNR9qv_rFCDI-fNevg.text: Oink was pointed out during a free walking tour of Edinburgh as one of the better places to go for lunch. This was enough for us, so we made our way here when our tour came to an end. The length of the queue and the shortage of seats inside initially seemed off-putting, but we decided it was worth staying, and indeed the queue moved quickly and seats became available.   The options fairly simple--you choose your bread (white or wheat), and your filling (slow-roasted pork, haggis, or both), sauces (there are several options) and crackling or not, and that's pretty much it. The sandwiches are definitely tasty, but ultimately not especially interesting, though they hit the spot for us and fortified us to continue our walking through the old town.

acuYuV-3Yx8Zj1iHLJov-Q.text: Now let me start out by prefacing I come from America, and having lived in the south home to BBQ I know what defines quality BBQ.   I ordered the BBQ sauce with the pulled pork (the only thing they serve is pulled pork). It was recommended by a staffer there who took my order and boy was it good. For under 6 I got a medium pulled pork serving which was quiet plentiful in my opinion and filling. The pulled pork tastes wonderful and is highly comparable to proper american BBQ. The place always would seem to have a line out the door and is fast at getting you your food. For this quality pulled pork you really cant manage to find anything that could beat it for the price. The only thing I would like to see is perhaps additions of sides to the menu such as corn bread which would pair really nicely with the pulled pork.

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lad eating some of the best pulled pork east of America

RfatrQK2MVzVqtqt_ECDeg.text: The perfect spot to to go for a quick, delicious, and affordable meal.   It's our go to spot whenever we're in town since they've got generous portions, the customer service is great, and the lines are quick. There's nothing like a huge roasted pig in the front to draw in customers!  There's limited seating inside, but most people finish their sandwiches in a few minutes so you won't be waiting long. You can choose your bread, toppings, and sauces so there's lots of options to customize.

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

6R-FZYshGLRMFvBBRzyKlQ.text: I've only been here a couple of times, but loved it each time. Great food, good wine, and a nice atmosphere. I love how it is a little quirky. You do need to make a reservation as it does get busy.  If you're just going for drinks it is table service, which I like as it means it doesn't get too crowded. Make sure to try the olives...

4Rb8DE_jDWTaUMtHfv9siA.text: Only meal we had in Edinburgh and we don't regret it! The pulled pork sandwich was delicious. You choose your size (small, medium, large) get a choice of base: haggis or sage onion, and a sauce (many options). A medium was perfect for me and actually still left room for dessert, which is perfect. The small is more like a kids size, or a snack. The large is the same bun as the medium with double to meat. My favorite part was the pork skin bit. It was super crispy and didn't have much fat. We got the onion base with apple sauce combination and..... so delicious!! I will definitely come back if I'm ever in Edinburgh again. There's not much seating area, people usually get it to go and eat as they walk. It's a rather small shop, and they close up once they sell out of the meat (they do one pig a day).

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Exterior
Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Interior

PWzsl8mwjbWLqA4L2cHMWg.text: Pink came recommended to us from a tour guide in England. While walking about in Edinburgh we found one of the three locations and they had pork left!! I loved what I had. If I ever get back to Edinburgh I most definitely make a beeline for Oink. Just amazing!

Bxh1hoY6pLw8jdmxXy4QfA.text: Great place to go, but only if you looove meat - especially pork. The pork is cooked extremely well and sandwiches are inexpensive, but still very generous portions. I ordered the grunter which is the largest size sandwich and paired it with haggis and spicy cheese sauce. This was my first time trying haggis and it was very good, but if that isn't quite your taste, then there are other topping options like sage and onion!  Great location as well and very friendly staff that helped me make a decision (I needed help deciding what to pair with Haggis).

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The biggest size pork sandwich (Grunter) with haggis and spicy cheese sauce.

nnf5NzJ-0EhXbq1FSV__Tg.text: This place came super recommended. It's just on Victoria Street, so it's very convenient for seeing the sites and stopping by for lunch. The interior is really cute and homey. It's pretty good deal (There are three sizes for pork rolls: Piglet 3.40 pounds, Oink 4.60 pounds, grunter 5.80 pounds).   Tastewise, it's a'ight. There wasn't anything special about the pork itself as it was quite dry and bland even with the sauce. The bun was just your regular run of the mill.   Bonus: If you do check this place out, make sure you ask for the freeee crackling (aka roasted pork skin). Be sure to get there early for lunch as they may run out.   We went around 1pm and there was a long line out the door. So perhaps aim to go slightly early to beat the crowds. The place itself is quite small, so if there is a line, you might not be able to wait it out and snag a seat inside which is just as well because eating in a park or on the go is just as fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The roasted pork at the storefront.
Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Meal deal: sandwich, chips, and drink of your choice from the display (featuring: Irn-Bru, Scotland&#39;s &#34;other national drink&#34;)

SftVpThvRqpWnE1MQ3lpww.text: I love the gimmick this place has. Every morning they get a full roasted pig and make their sandwiches, but once it's done, they close for the day. It's especially cool because they display the pig so you can see the progress. I would walk by at different times on different days and it was fascinating.   When I ordered one for myself I got the small with mustard mayo and onion sage stuffing. It was delicious! The meat is tender and juicy, with seasoning not too strong.  Worth going back a few times to try the different mixes they offer. I only had it once but had I had more time, you bet i'd be spending it here.

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

bvZRISki7581sDGPIEQFgw.text: We had Oink on our list of lunch spots to try and I'm so glad we did! Its right off the Royal Mile on Grassmarket. Great location to stop in for a quick sandwich in the midst of shopping and strolling. Price was good for the quality of food. Only downside is that its a small shop, so if its busy you may not get a seat. I would stick to either right before or right after the lunch rush to get a table. But still a good indication of how many people love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

CtergJp4tfa66kG9hVPDsg.text: Oink was recommended by one of my friends at home. I was actually surprised that it had so many yelp reviews.  Definitely come here for one of their lovely sandwiches.   A) because they taste amazing. Oink slow roasts one pig a day and serves it till it runs out. The meat is extremely juicy and flavorful.  B) prices are very good. A good size pork sandwich on roll with either haggis or stuffing is 4.20.  C)  The experience and scene on Victoria street is entertaining.  I would recommend the larger sandwich the grunter, with haggis, and pepper jam. It's mind blowingly good. Ask for some cracklings with it. They are free with the sandwich and pork skin heaven.  Take Away plenty of napkins as it's messy

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. They roast 1 hog a day when it&#39;s done they close up
Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lines are crazy but move fast
Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Grunter on brown roll, Hagis, pepper jelly and cracklings....awesome

Gwg_VjiPwmyZ-InPnkR9sA.text: Super simple concept.  Choose your size, choose a vessel (bread, or in a box), choose a sauce. Enjoy.  Looking in the window reminded me of filipino lechon. I do like that they give you pieces of the skin (which is the best part by the way).  The shop is extremely small - only room for maybe 20 total diners. My family of 5 decided to order the meat in a togo box and eat with a fork.   Overall it was really good. The apple sauce was maybe a little too sweet for my liking. I wish they had Mang Tomas as one of the sauce options.

J3MZZ2ZnVD1RmaAaQv9AVQ.text: This place cannot be passed up simply because as you walk past the aroma will draw you in. The store itself is fun. It's a smaller space but we had no trouble finding a place to sit and enjoy our sandwich.  I had the pork sandwich with Haggis. I was not disappointed. This sandwich made me feel like I needed to put Haggis on absolutely everything going forward. The taste was perfection. It was a well crafted sandwich.  I was pleasantly surprised by the cost - it was less than what I was expecting to spend.  The staff worked quickly and efficiently and got through the line very quickly. They were also all very pleasant. I would definitely recommend visiting oink if you are in the area it is very close to the Royal Mile. It's a fun area to sit and enjoy a meal.

J0h3uZaMiYqiH_xTtZIAkw.text: Delishhhh!  Their menu is simple: chose a size, bread (or carton if you're staying away from carbs), topping and sauce. Highly recommend the pulled pork with haggis and chili pepper jam. They also top it off with complimentary cracklings which was my favorite part!  The space is tight with only a few seats but folks rotate out fairly quickly. Seemed popular for both locals and tourists, and is located on quaint Victoria Street.

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

11cXMUoOe8KJxxdHNGJcFA.text: Oink! A simply delicious pulled pork sandwiches stop located on the beautifully cobblestoned Victoria Street. The window displays an entire roasted pig, a sight to behold!  You first choose the size of your roll (piglet, oink, or grunter) and type of roll (white or brown). Then, you pick the stuffing, sage and apple or the traditional haggis (both are delicious!!). There are 5 different sauces you can choose from to finish off your hog roast roll (apple and chili jam are my top picks!).   There is seating inside (stoolside), but very limited. The sandwiches come wrapped in foil, making it really convenient to take on the go! The pulled pork was so good we had to get more for the road! Be sure to ask for crackling!

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Front view/entrance
Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Oink sized rolls and the grunter (far right). Simple, yet delicious

ryjZooktSx2AoPAW1FKL3Q.text: When you pass by and see a pig being pulled apart you have two options, take the high road or indulge. I succumbed to the latter. The process is easy - how much meat, what toppings and give it a dressing. The meat is salty and tasty. I regret not getting something sweet to counter the saltiness but the chili paste was still solid. The staff was making fun of tourists and seem like they could care less than making the line move on. Still, enjoy sharing a sandwich here.

1rjZ1_DCfbk0nA1axtPxcg.text: Loved this place! Just off the Royal Mile. We all had pork sandwiches, chips and drinks for 6 of us for less than 40 pounds total. Staff was friendly and helpful. Food was very tasty and filling. Only downside is that it is small and very limited seating.  Most people just grab their food and eat it elsewhere, which is what we did.

LeQuVwS5aiuzEumu4WVF9w.text: Oink was on my list and was nice to see it confirmed by the number and quality of Yelp reviews and even better to see it live up to the hype. Between 3 various sizes of sandwich all below 8 pounds, you get a ton of pork, some stuffing (haggis or sage and onion), and a sauce to choose from. The pork is really tender and tasty. Bread is decent. Haggis acts some great texture and flavor. I really wish they had more sauce since it would really inject some more flavor. You can also get it without bread in a take out box. Overall, a really good value and would recommend. Only downside is the lack of sauce and wee size

SaY0P7qc2h8VwDo3gBobig.text: This is one of those shops off the royal mile you should go to if you're craving a quick, easy, and relatively inexpensive meal near the Royal Mile.   First off, you're immediately greeted with a fully (chopped up) pig in the window.  Ordering here is about as easy as "fast casual" gets:  - Choose the amount of meat you want aka piglet, oink, or grunter (aka small, medium, large) - Choose your breads, stuffing, and sauces  Being the all american eater that I am, I went with the grunter, had some haggis (because who doesn't order haggis when you're in Scotland), and chili jam. The combination was delicious and the meat was super tasty. All in was about $8 USD.

K2rNDjyypMtT8VKAbtB2YQ.text: Let's see.... How do you rate something simple,  comforting and without any fancy Ness around it?  I was gently welcomed by Dominic,  enthusiastic and dynamic staff from the place who made me feel welcomed and the experience was comforting and delicious! If you want to have a quick bite,  that's for you

qIsGKrL8ng48d2wZmRgKng.text: I had heard so much about Oink I had to check it out today! I figured I would love it, and I did! You just can't beat a quality sandwich. I went Sunday afternoon and I only had to wait in line for a few minutes. I had a regular size with stuffing and apple. The soft roll was delicious. All in all a wonderful idea and executed extremely well. I did not really find it soggy OR flavorless like some others did. I would like to try it with more toppings next time!

C2WHs9lPmfT0VykokOy0jA.text: BEST pulled pork I've ever had in my life. If you're in Edinburgh, you have to go here!! Great place to go if you're looking to try haggis as well. I thought it added a lot to the pulled pork sandwich and was delicious!

8uGCH5X81JSApSvSI-Udxg.text: What was my most memorable moment of my 10 day UK trip?  My first bite into Oink's "Grunter"!  No, not exaggerating, not really....  Ok ok, there are other really memorable moments in my trip, but I honest can say that if I have to list my top 10 most memorable moments, Oink would be somewhere on top.  If I am to list my BEST meal in this UK trip, Oink is DEFINITELY on the tippy top.  It's that good.  It really is....   Hubbo and I first shared a "grunter', their largest size sandwich.  We picked their spicy chili cheese sauce and haggis with lots of cracklins.  After my first bite, I told him to get his own...  I polished off the grunter and got up and bought a t-shirt and another grunter to take with me.  The store clerk asked where we were from.  "Jacksonville, northeast FL", I replied.  He was surprised and said he thought we would have plenty of BBQ pork places like Oink.    Yeah, not like this.... roasted whole hog stuffed with herbs with crispy skin and haggis?  Nope, definitely not.  The next day, we returned and bought three more grunters and asked the store clerk to 'package them well cause they are traveling'!  Yep, we took them on the train with us as we were leaving Edinburgh.

2FCax38q8fqsvfdrOvi_sA.text: Ooooh 3 stars, controversial.  So, I've been hearing about how Oink is the best place to get a quick bite in Edinburgh for aaaaaaaages.  People are enamoured with the pig in the window, the crackling, the sauces.  FINALLY, after a day of Christmas shopping, I had my chance to get me some Oink.    The space itself isn't the most attractive or welcoming, and I briefly attempted small chat with the two workers but quickly discovered that they pretty much wanted to fill my roll and be done with me.    I got my roll with haggis and a chili relish and while it was tasty and juicy, I appreciated the chili relish for the zing it added as without it, the roll would have been pretty bland.  I was given and saw no napkins, so felt that I'd rather made a mess of myself as well.    All in all, a rather disappointing experience.  Yes it filled my stomach and yes it tasted nice, but after all of the buildup, I was left unconvinced.

h1OTGDzvvz3fCRQVtt4dZQ.text: Even a quick skim of Oink reviews will give people the impression that this is, like, the BEST PLACE EVER. And it really is pretty good....but not outstanding. Pros: pretty cheap, good pork, quick service, good location. Cons: Soggy bread, not outstanding, too much hype. To be honest, if i just wanted some good pork, I'd just order the pork, crackling, and topping without the bread.

E_RVOvGR1fddVBPj9TBSWw.text: Incredibly friendly service and deliciously tender roast pig. We are not too familiar with haggis but they offered us a taste and it actually was quite good. We tried our sandwiches with the chili cheese sauce and it hit the spot. There is not much seating inside and it is cash only.

XR-H3UqOAr0oT8WazXwuhA.text: Amazing! Big serves and so tasty! The meat is divine and the stuffing was simply awesome. And they had Australian Bundaberg ginger beer! Mmmm...  Definitely recommended as a cheap, tasty and quick meal next time you are in Edinburgh.

DYB67at5RSPb_Syqg7bcKg.text: Stop by for a snack midday and you'll be quite satisfied with a tasty pork sandwich. Definitely recommend the onion stuffing and BBQ sauce on the sandwich. Well worth the few pounds but probably not a proper lunch spot

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

kkZGOIG_e8G0wmGVQ8GbHA.text: This place is perfect for a delicious sandwich. I go there every time I'm hangover and the Grunter sandwich sorts me out. Shame I can only give the place 5 stars, I could give it 7. The food is sublime and very cheap.

QosJzxz0zAIR6MTd3o4-vA.text: My husband & I were really excited to try Oink based on the strong yelp reviews that it had AND based on the fact that many, many locals told us repeatedly that it was a go to spot for them.  We actually tried to go the day before after a scotch tour but arrived too late in the day & they were already sold out (3:30pm).    So sad to report that we were quite disappointed.  I'll start w/the good: LOVE the location.  The street it is located on is a super adorable windy street w/tons of great shopping, pubs & whiskey shops nearby.  In addition, the roasted pig is presented right in front of the store front window so you immediately see it & it definitely catches peoples attention.  However.....maybe it's just because my husband makes AMAZING pulled pork & sauces and but I found the pork & sauces themselves to be just meh.  The pork really lacked flavor & spices - was actually quite bland.  I chose the sage & onion stuffing & the chili sauce as my two condiments & again, I just felt that both really lacked any flavor & bite to them.    I still give this place an extra star for uniqueness & it's ability to pull you in - but when it comes to the actual quality of the meal - I hate to admit it, but I was quite disappointed.

fdJgrN5rBZLYBq3UdbdO1Q.text: This is the quintessential example of doing one thing and doing it perfectly.  This place really only does one thing, pulled pork rolls, but the pork rolls you get here are hands down phenomenal.  I got one with haggis and chili cheese and I was in heaven for 5 minutes.  You can't ask for a better quick lunch in Edinburgh.

M8LAZfQmbC9zsk2K8up59A.text: Hog roast goodness.  Nice stuffing. Nice apple sauce. Reasonably priced. Total win!

4HUyK_JTCwODuKrn6PY8NQ.text: Oink does one thing, and it does it really well. I had added this on my list of places to try in Edinburgh because the husband and I are both fans of the pig, and with all of the rave reviews, we figured we couldn't go wrong. And we were right!   We stopped by for an early lunch after visiting Edinburgh castle, and Oink was everything we hoped it would be. Pink storefront and roasting pig in the window? Check! It doesn't get much fresher than that.  There was only one person in front of us, and two people enjoying their sandwiches at a table near the door. Because it wasn't packed, the owner bantered with us for a few minutes and he was very friendly.   We each ordered the medium sized option - mine with haggis, apple, and chili sauce on wheat, and my husband's with haggis and BBQ sauce on wheat. The owner also threw in a piece of crackling for my husband, which my husband loved. We grabbed a bottle of water, a handful of napkins, and were able to snag two of the seats indoors where we thoroughly enjoyed the porky goodness.  It was a perfect, delicious lunch. We didn't spend much money and left full and happy. Until the next time, Oink!!

UXnxo7mILnUHXCSuUJkFdA.text: The phenomenon of  "Roadkill cusine" has popped up in the media semi-regularly over the past few years as an alternative to Waitrose for thrifty carnivores nationwide. Unsurprisingly, flicking on the hazard lights and popping to the side of the road to bury one's head in the entrails of a recently flattened fox is still an acquired taste to some, but for those "on the fence" so to speak, Oink provides the ideal introduction.  It's fair to say that the British office monkey can often feel limited to a number of fairly sanitised options. The neverending stream of social-climbing delis half-heartedly scoop out bowls of hummus or red pesto chicken onto a tiresome array of flatbreads and as we fester in the queue, running down our precious minutes, the feeling that we're eating inauthentic crap made by arseholes, for arseholes never strays too far away. But Oink is different. There's not a ciabbata in sight. Just some plain bread rolls, some rudimentary sauces and the putrefying remains of an unfortunate local swine. Be in no doubt that this is the grisliest, most brutal and downright best lunch on offer in Scotland.  The animalistic experience on offer at Oink really is second to none. Looking on, mouth watering as the staff hack at the rotting carcass before feasting upon the ragged, sweaty flesh of the wretched pig is the closest most of us will ever get to those basal predatory instincts long lost to evolution. And all for about four quid.  After just one visit to Oink, you'll see a congealing tub of room-temperatrure mediterranean tuna salad for what it really is. Pathetic.

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. from website
Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. from website

s87yrTqlU_GRv9SFyNn5pw.text: What a great concept! With the whole hog presented in the window, it's real as fresh and honest as it gets. I tried the kids sandwich with their most popular sauce, and it was worth every pound! I can't wait to come back and get it again. Worth the trip!

YgkEdsTARB6EIwKnkfQ15g.text: If you're reading this review and you haven't tried Oink, you NEED to take 30 minutes out of your day tomorrow and get down to this mecca of glutinous pork-flesh.   -You need to order brown bread, medium size(oink), haggis and chilli sauce.   -Ask for some crackling.   -There isn't a great deal of seating inside so I recommend you walk down to the Grassmarket.   -Find a park bench, preferably to yourself as you'll want to lie spread-eagle for a while once you're done.   -Assess your surroundings, because if you attack this glorious takeaway feast anything like me, that is, something similar to a feeding scene from Jurassic Park, you should probably wait for any nearby children to leave.   -Take a deep breath      AND ENJOY!  If you're a red-blooded carnivore, you'll surely enjoy. I hope you enjoy. Please enjoy! I love this place and if YOU, dear reader, don't like this place, I don't think we have very similar tastes and my reviews are probably wasted on you. Exceptions for vegans/vegetarians.  Life-pro-tip: Probably not a good idea to go swimming for a day or two after eating at Oink. Actually, you probably shouldn't attempt ANY vigorous activity, because this place is like taking a delicious meaty headbutt to the stomach.

Ab_jVkbv9uxV265OJ0CVMg.text: I'm always up for meat off of a whole hog! We were just walking by after a visit to the castle and couldn't resist giving it a try!  We got the large pork on white with the onion sage stuffing and BBQ. We went and found a bench on Grass Market and the sandwich  was perfect for sharing. The only thing we would have done different is we would have asked for extra BBQ sauce. Other than that it was fantastic! It really hit the spot!

l1FvQ95z08AO08qkRmb4cQ.text: Stopped by during the late May bank holiday off Rick Steve recommendation and loved it.     Being an American Southern gal I'm a little uptight on my pork reviews but this hit the spot.  It was a little dry but was sooo close.    I enjoyed an Oink with sage & onion stuffing and BBQ sauce.    The husband had haggis and apple sauce on his.    Should have read the reviews here as I would have mixed that up and tried with the chilli cheese sauce and crackling.    We had 3 sandwiches (2 for the husband, 1 for me) and 2 bottles of water for under 15.  This was the perfect quick, cheap, and delicious stop for lunch and very close to all the top tourist attractions.  As a side note, The coffee machine was broken and they take cash only.   Also very limited seating so be prepared to scarf down on the sidewalk.

8rTZpMdZ-K6Xf1GMdAfoWg.text: My first time trying haggis, admittedly you can't taste it much amidst all the pork, but really it was a good and quick lunch. I recommend taking it to go and eating outside if the weather is good. The 'oink' is the regular size, but I think the 'grunter' would be the way to go if you're really hungry. Really reasonable priced as well, I got the oink and a root beer for around 5 pounds if I remember correctly.

kRXy91uA363pjP4dQDeoJw.text: Not the same experience as others here.  She asked "What size?". I said " medium please". Was never offered stuffing or apple sauce but when I asked, 2 seconds later, I was told "it was too late since I should have stated it up front." Thanks for that! Pork was a bit bland and the cheap white bun went soggy. Apart from that, some decent stodge but nothing more.

wlfcb5YvxtRBz9YafyHHfg.text: Good-tasting sandwich, but you might not be full after eating the sandwich. Also a little pricey for not filling my tummy.

dmqj44Sjd9mGwciVj8kE-w.text: Fast, cheap, delicious. Had haggiss for the first time. The smallest size is extremely tiny but the medium size is large enough to share if you want to grab a quick bite to eat. We had white bread. Apple with sage and onion was a good pairing but haggis with chili cheese was better. You also get offered crackling to add to your sandwich. I highly recommend this place!

27lD9QR6TFPV6omzPvfQcw.text: I asked the gentleman taking my order "What is haggis?"  He responded "It's delicious."  Good enough for me! I devoured the sandwich stuffed with this mysterious paste....and he was right.  Amazing.  Must stop if you're in Edinburgh.

940cgEqjThSE8ZVJoSOGYg.text: I'm a pork lover, and the sandwich was ridiculously good. Strongly recommend with the chili jam. Also, you must try the cracklin.

7Qs7H8HB_TvZOyOpSnwViA.text: Hearty portion, excellent bread, good sauce, a great value.

vzEwySdFT-BhsOUC5f5Obg.text: this place was mad good, it was quick and easy but the food was really tasty! I had a brown roll with onion and sage stuffing and apple sauce. I loved it! Others in our group had BBQ sauce and Hot Chilli Sauce. We will definitely be back.

RXSQUrWc5w4XO-3BP0Mfmg.text: went with my husband and let's face it who doesn't love pork in a nun. We shared a sandwich and it was soooo yummy. We added drinks and sat outside to enjoy, it was so delicious I could hear my scale ticking up. I would do this again but splitting

NK-g12szpVF1nvZZV7UrOw.text: When you only have one thing on the menu, you darned well better do it right. And when I say one thing, they have... ONE. THING. It's the "Hog Roast Sandwich" which arrives on a yummy split roll. The only choices are extras: chilli sauce, sage & onion stuffing, applesauce and cracklins.  There's nothing here if you're a vegetarian or you don't eat pork, though I suppose you could just have the roll. :-)  Melt in your mouth, tender pieces of roasted pork, carved off the hog when you order. How do you know it's fresh carved? Because the guest of honor is right there in the shop window. He's in hog heaven now.  There is a cooler of drinks - Coke, water, juices - and not much else. 80p for the bottled water I had. Finding the place was a challenge, as their signage is minimal. Note that it's on Victoria Street, not Victoria Terrace.

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Yummy, but not kosher

CD47SUdH957-0plHhGbsbA.text: Yum! I took my brother here while he was visiting as I'd never been and had seen the rave reviews on Yelp. Man oh man, it was so tasty! For less the a fiver you get a good sized roll with heaps of meat on it. You can choose from a white or whole wheat bun, one spread and one sauce. You can get either haggis or apples and then bbq sauce or a gravy I think. Either way, anything they offer is a tasty addition.  I opted for the haggis as I hadn't really tried it properly yet here and it added a nice flavour with the deliciously, well-cooked meat. I am not normally a pork eater, but on this occasion it was totally necessary as it was a delicious and different eat. We took it away and ate it in the park off Grassmarket, to bask in the sun and stuff our wee faces. It is a very tasty option and doesn't feel too gluttonous, as you can order a kid sized roll to feel less like a carnivore. Although for the price, go big or go home I say. Well worth a visit to this place for a roast/BBQ lunch in hand.

UuxJ2dMqBjpyJa_jYE8JzQ.text: It was my last day in Edinburgh and I decided to eat as much as I can around the city.  I had the piglet size sandwich with the sage and onion and my friend got the apple sauce with the pork. The meat is juicy and my most favorite was the piece of crisps pork skin on top. Delicious! I will be back next time I visit.

BpoEklJV7S4qDPQXHCqZLw.text: Oink provides a hearty sandwich for a decent price. A full roast pig greets you in the window and you can get (as I usually do) the full roast pork extravaganza - roast pork, sage stuffing, apple sauce and lovely salty crackling all in a bread roll of your choice (brown, white etc.). Very good value and will keep you going all day. Nice moist pork, salty crackling with a good bite, tart apple sauce to cut through that lovely unctuous greasiness. Mmmmm. Bring me more.  Just don't expect a smile with your food, the server are a fairly grumpy lot. Plus, I would research exactly what you want before you go because they expect you to know!

BuxKXV_FDHEfmixZJxX7jw.text: Limited menu but they do what they do well! Good food at affordable prices. Basic selection - don't offer much past pork (which, to be fair, could be expected)

-h8t-mStcOBsyuBimDWZUw.text: Love it! Came here everyday during my stay in Edinburgh The pork is just on point, I wish I dared to try the haggis they also sold

xl6RxtE-UKcnAA0CIZv4yQ.text: Great pork sandwich. It was a quick bite to eat that I really enjoyed. However it is cash only unless you buy a lot of sandwiches to get your bill over a certain amount and there isn't much seating or seating near by. But it is a central location and good food.

o6SWqk4Li1Pes5EuWuU49Q.text: Visual of the whole roasted pig draws you to this place.  Expecting an above average to stellar pulled pork was implied given their simple yet fun menu.  The pork was good, but methinks a bit too salted with the crackling and haggis. Darn, shoula woulda gotten the applesauce to mellow it with some sweetness..but thought it a bit overboard w/ toppings.  It was good enough for my lunch/snack(?) but nothing beyond the norm.  It wasn't great, just simple straightforward good- enough. Would not mind trying another, next time with a fun mix of different toppings.  Its a fun joint for a hearty, on- the-go bite but not necessarily my first or second choice.  All in all, not bad.

vVXPsrxYrWwkzmiFZX0LBw.text: Well ...........................Oinky goodess in a bap!!!  I went here a good few months ago, and I loved it !! How pllued pork has taken off and it is soo tasty. This little place is great for meat craving. We got a pulled pork roll with stuffing and we managed to grab a little seat next to the window and chomp chomp. Its not the fancied of places, infact id say that its more of a takeaway, grab and go styleee. Definatley worth trying and great value for money.

prMcMalN-xQM06g9QgHQhQ.text: AH MAZE ING.  Went here based on the yelp reviews.. Was not disappointed.    Day 1 - got the regular roll, wheat bread, sage and onion stuffing, apple sauce.  forgot to ask for a cracklin.  Don't forget to ask for the cracklin!!!  As I was eating it, I knew I would be back.  I actually planned my day to make sure I could get back.  Day 2 - got the bigger sandwich, all of the above, some mil chili sauce and remembered the cracklin (whew.  What kind of Southerner am I, forgetting a cracklin?  Oh wait, I am a Northerner; I just live in the South.)  Note - minimal seating, so be willing to cram in next to some new friends.  Mine were two old gentlemen who were taking a break from rugby watching.  They made sure I had napkins when I needed them.  Got a mocha both days - very good!

EanqLiObVrpO0pk4qP6F-A.text: Grunter. Haggis. Chilli relish if I'm feeling a bit randy.  Napkin, Fork, Foil.   Damn. Life's. Good.

SE-4HFbPENbBqbASc4HjMw.text: Amazing pork roll! Perfect after hiking Arthur's Seat. Ask for the crackling--it's worth it. The apple sauce and BBQ sauce compliment the pork perfectly. Dreaming about this sandwich from California

TwIDdZJMjmoqPBkmvVdDiA.text: My husband insists on a stop here every time we are in town!  Since I'm pregnant and not trying to be healthy like usual, I indulged in the delicious pulled pork (literally straight from the roasted pig in the window) on a brown roll with sage/onion stuffing and applesauce - divine!  Would highly recommend that combo, although my husband would say he likes it with haggis and hot chili sauce, but that's the best bit - there's something for everyone.  Sandwiches come in different sizes so you can stuff yourself or just have a bit of lunch.  It's cheap, the meat is delicious and juicy, and the condiment choices are simple but brilliant.  It's an Edinburgh staple and a must-try if you're in town!

pCE4ykd6y-ehsfJUJfJ8Gg.text: Delicious pork here. You see the roasted pig in the window as you walk by. Ordering is a snap, you can get sandwiches or meat in a box. We had the meat in the box and the haggis spread and spicy bbq sauce. Delicious.

qB3RPON_fCpKEMyokkY2Hw.text: Came in after a very long Sunday walk, and came away completely satisfied. My girlfriend and I split two sandwiches - one with haggis and mustard mayo, and one with sage and onion and apples. Both offer something a little different and are equally excellent. The sage/onion/apple pairing is probably the better overall, as it mixes some good sweetness to counterbalance the richness of the pork. That's not to say that the haggis and mustard isn't good, it's just richer. I'd happily have again either in the future.

cWxhGelwTuxEUXAklhUM1A.text: My second time in Edinburgh and my second delicious oink.  This place has a queue down the street for a reason and I'm jealous of the people that get to eat here regularly.  A definite must if you've not been before!!!   Cash only.

UMb383JPwz5LkEaHHth4kw.text: Pretty good food for the price. In my opinion it's pretty average and overhype but still worth the try.

KIbDrDB4-bsnW4o2S3lJ_w.text: I was catching up on what's new in the Yelpiverse, when Oink fell into the top spot on my "Your Next Review Awaits" queue. I'm obviously slacking. So... this Oink is pretty much a carbon copy of THIS Oink: yelp.co.uk/biz/oink-edin... Therefore, my sentiments in that review ring True for this spot as well. Oink remains to be one of the best spots to score a quick meal under 5. I still opt for The Grunter, because i'm still a monster. I have branched out into apple sauce (I know, so cool.) and my intuition on the extra sauce was on point. So what new tidbits have I picked up since last year in the land of Oink? Did you know you can order a WHOLE HOG?! I was delighted. I have yet to do it, but the fact that it's an easily ordered possibility makes me happy. Unfortunately, I rarely have occasions where I need to feed 130 meat eaters, but I remain hopeful. The catering option I most recently found and will likely weave its way into an event soon is the Leg It. You can order a whole leg of pork that feeds 25 people for 90. It even comes with stuffing, rolls & apple sauce. So that's brilliant. I'm always on the look out for spots that could potential feed an event with very little effort on my part, so this was a happy happenstance, but until I get my hands on a reason to order a hog leg, i'll happily stick with Oink being my "i'm lazy and it's cheap" lunch refuge.

YZxGiWPewhwcETQ81vol5g.text: It's yummy, it's fast, it's easy.   Is it a little on the expensive side, yes. But it's hard to get good BBQ in Edinburgh and they certainly do a great job. Not to mention, you can get free crackling to add some crunch to your sandwich.

Vclcj1B8BROs9u2ASZMbmg.text: Got the grunter...ton of meat straight out the pig. Good BBQ sauce, hagis too.  Delicious quick lunch especially for 1-2 people.

T5or594lwZgGpb5fmfsbuw.text: O.M.G. !!! Oink is amazing!  Their specialty is pulled pork sandwiches with a variety of spreads and toppings.  We came to eat here twice and had:  the Oink (medium sandwich) on brown bread...one with haggis and one with sage and onion stuffing.  the Grunter (large sandwich) on white bread (a whole lot more meat)...this time both with haggis...one with mustard/mayo sauce and one with sweet pepper jelly.  So. Dang.GOOD!! Great prices too! Kept us fed and warm during our stay.  You gotta go here! Staff are VERY friendly and quick with the orders.  Tip: the Piglet is a small roll with meat. the Oink is a medium size roll with meat and the Grunter is also a medium size roll only with double the meat of the Oink. Only two choices of bread; brown or white..(but you don't need more than that)

lf0Q9MWpWtTb21erTs141w.text: Oink had me at whole-roasted Scottish hog. The menu is simple: pick a size, a brown or white soft roll, a filling (stuffing or haggis), and a sauce. We got a piglet with stuffing and apple and an oink with haggis and homemade BBQ sauce. Of the two, I highly recommend the haggis and BBQ sauce combo. It was really flavorful and complemented the pork. The stuffing/apple combo was a little bland by comparison, although still good. A great place to grab a quick, affordable and tasty lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sandwich assembly in progress.
Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whole roasted pig. Yum!

UINgBwa00TGos8ViFtp8KA.text: Super fast. Friendly staff. Great value for money. Small menu...only serves pork sandwiches with a few sauce options. High food quality - a great quick grab.

k6FZ3pPcIiR-lmaRQqqa9g.text: Tiny, tiny place with barely any seating so you'll see peoples standing outside the shop eating their DELICIOUS pork sandwiches. Basically Oink kills a farm-fresh pig everyday, cook and season the meat, and sell the pork sandwiches until they run out of pork from that ONE pig that day. Let me tell you this meat is delicious. So flavorful, so juicy and perfectly seasoned. You can get your sammy with 2 choices of bread (white or brown), 2 choices of stuffing (haggis or onion/sage I think -- BOTH are delicious but I prefer the latter), and a choice of topping. My favorite is their apple relish. OMFG. This pork with pieces of apple and the stuffing on the toasted soft bun....HEAVEN. I ate here twice on my 5 day trip. I just couldn't get enough! Seriously, I wish we had something like this in California. Farm-fresh meat and quality sandwiches = a winning combo!  BONUS- Super affordable to eat here. A piglet sized sandwich will fill me up and it's only $2.60 euro or so. C'mon what a steal!

GHoPa31co4eIl6pJro_ghA.text: Great pulled pork spot. Good value with a combo for 6. Though bagged chips and bottled drinks were nothing special. Not much seating so you may need to takeaway if busy.

68bOj_z29JtSCQs8rq0V7A.text: The absolute best thing I ate in Scotland. The sandwiches were large and the pork was super tender. Definitely try all the homemade sauces.

cAD3euaQ59H3hyTsjaAEQA.text: Awesome hole in the wall shop. The meat was delicious. I had it with the apple sauce and it was really yummy. Super filling!

KAr3plS_PDy5kEf-9NyK7w.text: My friend introduced this when I came to Edinburgh. So I waited for about ten mins. The burger was very good,I like its taste!!!You can choose onion or haggis,and there are also many sauces. The service is quickly and nice!

photos.caption: Photo of Oink - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. sooo funny

g6nrMph2GecV3gqulsp9Bg.text: Wish I could've had more but we were saving room for dinner. SO delicious. Nice bite, good vibe. Had the piglet size with BBQ and sage and onion stuffing. Hit the spot.

yam5ipbJyDQBz8qcBTE2-w.text: You can't walk past this place with out salivating!  We nipped in whilst on our trip to Edinburgh as the smell of the sandwiches were just too good to refuse. The meat was lovely and moist and the toppings tasty too. I felt it was over-priced for what it was...but hey I guess in a city centre and with public demand they can get away with charging what they do. I would also of liked the stuffing to be nice and crispy but that is personal preference. The stuffing with the apple sauce was a combo made in heaven.  Definitely worth a visit if you're wanting to satisfy a rumbly tummy!

QUaFLOBVOKPz_sNHWaXX0g.text: I had really high hopes for this place however they were slightly crushed.   The idea and display that they put on is awesome. It gathers crowds.   Unfortunately the food isn't very nice... Meat lacks seasoning and flavour. Combined with the stuffing and apple sauce this sandwich really lacks a crunchy component. Shortly after the sauce start flowing the bun joins in on the soggy mess.   Price is good value for money. Only letdown was the food.

A4tRNs9QRQfUHpnu1J3eJA.text: I had a white roll w/ onion stuffing and apple sauce. Personally not a huge fan of that sweet sauce which did not pair up well with the pork. The meat was tender though. I also asked for cracklings, but the guy obviously forgot.   Bottom line: a cheap place to get a decent pork roll if you happen to walk by, but does not worth a trip specifically for that.
